chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:12 AM Cases called: 22CF376 & 22CM279. Defendant Sean B Silvan in court, in custody.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Sean B Silvan.  Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for State of Wisconsin. The parties have reviewed the report. 
Re-evaluation is requested by the parties to get a more thorough report. Defendant does not want to go to a treatment facility to participate in an evaluation. Counsel to contact doctor to inquire about protocols in the interview process. 
Then a new hearing can be scheduled

by Ryan Stepp, Psy.D., dated 09/02/2022

3:06 PM cases 22CF376, 22CM279 called. Prosecuting Attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean B Silvan in court, in custody with Attorney Karl A Schmidt. 
Attorney Schmidt is requesting a competency evaluation. 

Court orders a competency evaluation. 

Competency Hearing set for 09/14/2022 at 8:00 AM

10:02am Cases called: 22CF376 & 22CM279. Prosecuting attorney Trenton John Piltz Mr in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Sean B Silvan not in court.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Sean B Silvan. Attorney Schmidt believes his client is in Buffalo County Jail. Attorney Schmidt will contact the JA to set up a hearing.
Return date on July 13, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Dated 07/08/2022, Letter from Attorney Karl Schmidt to Court requesting a competency evaluation.
Status conference on November 28, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Reserve Judge William Gabler for Branch 1. 
(Cases 22CF376, 22CM279 are called at 3:30 PM- by Zoom) Defendant Sean B Silvan appeared by video, in custody from the Buffalo County Jail.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Sean B Silvan. Attorney Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Court advises the Defendant of charges and potential penalties in both cases. Defense indicates the Defendant has not seen the Informations, but Defense has gone over the Informations with the Defendant. Defendant enters Not Guilty pleas in both cases in all counts. Court receives Not Guilty pleas to both cases and all counts. Victim/Witness statute complied with. 
Counsel to contact the Branch 1 Judicial Assistant for further scheduling in both cases.
Arraignment on June 28, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Adding Count 2- Felony Theft.

(2:43 PM cases 22CM279, 22CF376 called.) All parties and court personnel appear via Zoom. 
Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sean B Silvan appeared by video, in custody in the Buffalo County Jail.  Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Sean B Silvan.
Defendant waives right to a personal appearance and wants to proceed. Court accepts the defendant's waiver to a personal appearance.
Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing and Court accepts waiver.
Attorney Schmidt to schedule an Arraignment with the Branch 1 Judicial Assistant.
of Preliminary Hearing

(1:31 PM cases 22CM279, 22CF376 called.) Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Sean B Silvan appeared by video, in custody in the Buffalo County Jail without counsel.
Defendant advised of right to an attorney. 
State advises is ready to proceed. Defendant advises isn't sure if he wants an attorney or not.

Defendant is to appear next week to advise if he wants an attorney and has applied for one or if he is waiving right to an attorney.
Defendant advised to contact the State Public Defender's Office.
Hearing scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
